title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of cash using variables. The number of 49-cent stamps was five less than three times the number of 35-cent stamps, so you can represent 49-cent stamp as $$3t-5(where$$ $$t$$ is 35-cent stamp).
speech: Represent the number of each type of cash using variables. The number of 49-cent stamps was five less than three times the number of 35-cent stamps, so you can represent 49-cent stamp as  3 t minus 5 parentheses where   t,  is 35-cent stamp).

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the number of each stamp type(in variable form) by its respective value.
speech: Multiply the number of each stamp type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their cash values into a single equation. This will be $$0.49\left(3t-5\right)+0.35t=15.75$$

title: Substitution
text: Plug $$t$$ into the original relationship to find $$3t-5$$.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is $$25$$ 49-cent stamps and $$10$$ 35-cent stamps.
speech: The answer is  25  49-cent stamps and  10,  35-cent stamps.
